parameters.text:
=Company input:
{{ JSON.stringify($json.company_input, null, 2) }}

Search snippets (top 10 results):
{{ JSON.stringify($json.search_snippets, null, 2) }}

Your task:
- From company_input + snippets, extract the **top competitors** (company names, websites, LinkedIn if visible).
- Return in STRICT JSON.
- Do not add explanations or text outside JSON.

assignments.name: result
company_key
profile_json
competitors_json

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.value: Mozilla/5.0(Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36(KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/124.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

assignments.name: fetch_status
assignments.value: ={{   (() => {     const html = $json.raw_page || '';     if (!html) return 'empty';     return /browser-not-supported|enable javascript|403 forbidden|access denied/i.test(html)       ? 'blocked_or_js_heavy'       : 'ok';   })() }}

assignments.name: page_text
assignments.value: ={{   (() => {     const html = $json.raw_page || '';     if (!html) return '';     if (/browser-not-supported|enable javascript|403 forbidden|access denied/i.test(html)) return '';     return html       .replace(/<script[\s\S]*?<\/script>/gi,'')       .replace(/<style[\s\S]*?<\/style>/gi,'')       .slice(0,3000);   })() }}

assignments.name: pages_ok
assignments.value: ={{ ($json.data || []).filter(i => i.fetch_status === 'ok' && i.page_text).map(i => ({ competitor: i.competitor_name || 'unknown', url: i.watch_url || '', text: (i.page_text || '').replace(/\s+/g,' ').slice(0,1500) })) }}

options.systemMessage:
You are an AI Competitive Intel Extractor.

INPUT: JSON array pages_ok[] where each item is:
{ competitor, url, text }. Work only from this text.

GOAL: Extract concise, concrete signals, favoring:
- Pricing/plan details or changes (currency, cadence).
- New features, renamed product lines, major launches/press.
- Route removals or 404s that indicate deprecations/moves.
- Homepage/metadata cues (e.g., og:updated_time, taglines).

If a page is blocked/JS-only it wonâ€™t appear in pages_ok. Use what you have.
Itâ€™s acceptable to pull evidence from titles/meta tags or short phrases.

RULES:
- No speculation; base every signal on phrases/numbers present in text.
- Use small quotes as evidence (no HTML blobs).
- Max output 450 tokens.
- If you still have no clear signals, return a brief â€œobservationsâ€ entry and a minimal action plan.

STRICT JSON SCHEMA:
{
  "company_key": "",
  "date": "",
  "findings": [
    {
      "competitor": "",
      "url": "",
      "signals": [ "short bullet" ],
      "price_examples": [
        { "plan": "", "price": "", "currency": "", "cadence": "" }
      ],
      "evidence": "one sentence with exact phrase/number"
    }
  ],
  "observations": [ "optional generic but useful notes" ],
  "action_plan": [
    "â‰¤3 concrete next steps (pricing test, email, ad tweak, landing page update)."
  ]
}
Return ONLY JSON per schema.

assignments.name: report
report_html
intel
assignments.value: ={{   (function () {     const raw = typeof $json.output === 'string'       ? JSON.parse($json.output)       : ($json.output || {});     return {       company_key: raw.company_key || $json.company_key || '',       date: raw.date || new Date().toISOString().slice(0,10),       findings: Array.isArray(raw.findings) ? raw.findings : [],       observations: Array.isArray(raw.observations) ? raw.observations : [],       action_plan: Array.isArray(raw.action_plan) ? raw.action_plan : [],     };   })() }}

parameters.content:
## Onboarding (Competitor Discovery & Setup)

Description:
This workflow captures a new company input (from a form submission or manual entry), normalizes the data, and uses AI (Competitor Finder) + SerpAPI to discover relevant competitors. The output is formatted for storage and saved into Google Sheets:

Company Profile Sheet â†’ stores the company being monitored (name, industry, website, contact).

Competitor List Sheet â†’ stores discovered competitors with their metadata (website, LinkedIn, etc.).

ðŸ’¡ This creates the foundation dataset of companies and competitors that the second workflow can monitor.

## Monitoring (Competitor Signals Monitoring)

Description:
This workflow runs on a schedule (e.g., daily) to fetch competitor websites and extract intelligence signals.

Fetches active companies and their competitors from the Sheets.

Builds and executes HTTP requests to competitor â€œwatch URLsâ€ (pricing, products, technology pages).

Parses the responses to capture meaningful text, status, and signals.

Aggregates and formats the results into a structured competitor intelligence report.

Saves the report in Google Sheets and sends a polished HTML email to the user with Findings, Observations, Action Plan, and Priority levels.

ðŸ’¡ This workflow acts like an automated competitor monitoring assistant, delivering daily CI updates straight to your inbox.

assignments.name: company_input
search_snippets

json.Location: 2788 San Tomas Expressway, Santa Clara, California
